description: ArchivesSpace is an open-source web application designed to support core archival functions, such as accessioning, describing and arranging materials, managing authorities and rights, and providing reference services, all while supporting collection management through dedicated records, event tracking, and administrative reports.
Usability & Accessibility: As an Archivist, I want to see Dates and Extents displayed in both the read and edit views for Accessions and/or Resources before the list of Subjects.
As an Archivist, I want to rearrange the Resource and/or Digital Object hierarchy using keyboard-based navigation.
As an Archivist, I want to rearrange the resource description hierarchy by dragging an archival object to a different position in the hierarchy.
As an Archivist, I want to import (Encoded Archival Description) EAD files that were exported by Archon.
As an Archivist, I want to import (Encoded Archival Description) EAD files that were exported by the Archivists' Toolkit.
As an archivist, I want to search within a repository for resource and accession and digital object records.
As an archivist, I want to create and edit a Collection Management subrecord.
As an Archivist, I want to create and edit Event records.
As an Archivist, I want to manage Digital Objects.
As an Archivist, I want to associate an Instance with a Resource and/or Resource Component.
As an Archivist, I want to create and edit Rights Management statements.
As an Archivist, I want to create and edit Agent records.
As an Archivist, I want to create and edit a Resource record.
As an Archivist, I want to associate a Subject record with a Resource description.
As an Archivist, I want to associate an Instance with a Container.
As an Archivist, I want to assign Location information to a Container.
As an Archivist, I would like to indicate an Agent is either the creator, source, or subject of an Accession or Resource or Resource Component.
As an Archivist, I want to specify the Source for a Name Form of an Agent and add new Sources and edit existing Sources.
As a researcher, I want to be able to view a finding aid for a particular collection/Resource.
As a Basic Data Entry user, I want to create and update basic archival description information.
Integrability & Interoperability: As an Archivist, I want to import Accessions data in CSV.
As an Archivist, I want to import Resources from MARCXML records.
As an Archivist, I want to import Agent information from EAC-CPF records.
As an Archivist, I want to export agent records as EAC-CPF.
As an Archivist, I want to import only Agent and Subject information from MARCXML records.
As an Archivist, I want to upload an EAD for import from within the frontend application.
As an Archivist, I want to import EAD data.
As an Archivist, I want to export a description as EAD.

As an Archivist, I want the overall data export process to be implemented as a pipeline, so that records pass through clearly defined transformation stages and are consistently formatted for external systems.
Security & Confidentiality: As a User, I want to authenticate using LDAP.
As an Application Administrator, I want to assign Users to an Advanced Data Entry and ensure that the appropriate permissions are enforced.
As an Archivist, I don't want to inadvertently overwrite someone else's changes to a record that I'm editing.
As a User, I want to authenticate locally.
As a User, I want to be able to log in.
As an Administrator, I want sensitive data to be masked at specific stages of processing, so that data privacy is maintained during multi-step transformations.
Manageability & Maintainability: As an Application Administrator, I want to be able to reset a User's password for them.
As a migration specialist, I want to store the AT or Archon source record IDs in each ArchivesSpace record to support data migration integrity testing.
As an Application Administrator, I want to be able to configure the help center URL and topic mappings.
As an Administrator, I want to create a new User account for someone else.
As a Developer, I want to use a configuration that is not prepackaged within a built version of the application.
As a systems administrator, I want to be able to control the location of the demo database and have it backed up.
As a Repository Manager, I want to create, update, and delete archival descriptions in my repository.
As a Repository Manager, I want to create, update, and delete any records in my repository.
As an System Administrator, I want to declare that a user has the Repository Manager role for a given Repository.
As a Developer, I want the batch processing of large data imports to be executed in a series of processing steps, so that system stability is maintained during heavy loads.
As an Archivist, I want to assign a component unique identifier to a Resource Component.
As an Archivist, I want to associate a standard identifier string with a Subject heading.
As an Archivist, I want to add administrative data about the archival description and finding aid-related data to a top-level Resource.
Modularity & Extensibility: As a user, I want backend changes for managing enum lists.
As a user, I want frontend changes for managing enum lists.
As a user, I want backend changes to support loading enum value lists from the database.
As a user, I want backend changes for bulk updating one enum value to another.
As a user, I want to add additional properties for repositories.
As an Archivist, I want to add Notes to other record types.
As a Developer, I want to develop a custom importer.
As an Archivist, I want the import mechanism to support dynamically integrated modules for handling various file formats.
As a Developer, I want to configure processing stages through external settings, so that additional transformation steps can be added as requirements evolve.
As an Archivist, I want to assign a Level of description to a Resource or Resource Component and optionally specify another value if the Level is not in a predefined list.
Performance Efficiency & Resource Utiliz: As an Archivist, I want the import process to run through a multi-stage transformation that validates, transforms, and loads records, so that large batches of data can be processed efficiently without impacting system performance.
As a Developer, I want the data export process to be implemented in a sequential manner, so that resource-intensive formatting tasks are distributed over multiple steps for optimal performance.
As an Archivist, I want large-scale data imports to be handled in stages, so that processing load is evenly distributed and overall performance remains optimal.
Implementability & Ease of Development: As an Archivist, I want to be able to understand that an error occurred during import and why it might have occurred.
As an Authenticated User, I want to get access to links to contextual help.
As a Developer, I want the transformation logic for data imports to be modularized into independent processing units, so that each unit can be developed, tested, and maintained separately.
As a Developer, I want comprehensive logging and error handling at each processing step, so that issues in the data transformation flow can be quickly diagnosed.
Analyzability & Traceability: As a System Administrator, I want detailed metrics and logs generated at each stage of the data processing flow, so that I can trace record transformations and analyze performance at every step.
As a Developer, I want to trace the lineage of data as it moves through each processing stage, so that I can pinpoint where errors or performance issues occur.
